neither.translation[0].definitions[0].de: not one or the other of two people or things
neither.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: ‘Would you like tea or coffee?’ ‘Neither, thanks.’
It was a game in which neither team deserved to win.
We asked both John and Jerry, but neither one could offer a satisfactory explanation.
Thompson had two strategies, neither of which seems to have worked very well.

neither.translation[1].definitions[0].de: used to show that a negative statement is also true about another person or thing
neither.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: ‘I don’t have any money.’ ‘Neither do I.’
Tom didn’t believe a word she said, and neither did the police.
neither.translation[2].definitions[0].de: used to add another negative statement about someone or something
neither.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The authorities were not sympathetic to the students’ demands, neither would they tolerate any disruption.
